      This method is executed when the login label is pressed from the beginning screen upon program start.
      void addProductButton()
      This method gets the input from the name, manufacturer and type fields, saves them to a SQL String query, checks the fields to make sure they're not null, then sends myString into the call to insertToDB and creates a product object in a switch statement that has cases based on the saved ItemType enumeration from the input.

      void logoutUser()
      When the logout button is pressed, this method is called and returns the user to the login screen and sets the production tabs to disabled.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      I used this main method to generate the config.properties file and save my database information to it.
      void recordProductionButton()
      This method takes a selected product and number and creates a new production record with them along with the time the production record was created.

    • Field Detail

      • tabpane

        public javafx.scene.control.TabPane tabpane
        The Tabpane.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()

    • Method Detail

      • accessLoginPressed

        public void accessLoginPressed()
        This method is executed when the login label is pressed from the beginning screen upon program start. It essentially sets the visibility of certain scene-builder objects to true or false.

      • accessCreateAccountPressed

        public void accessCreateAccountPressed()
        This method is executed when the create account label is pressed from the beginning screen upon program start. It utilizes the same visibility concept as stated above.

      • createAccountPressed

        public void createAccountPressed()
        This method fist gets the user input of name and password from the text and password containers and checks to see if the input is null. If not true, then an employee account is created and saved to the employee list. Finally, it iterates through the employee list, finds the employee with the specific name and gets its generated username and displays it so the user can then login with it.

      • loginPressed

        public void loginPressed()
        This method checks to see if entered info is null. If not true, the employee list is searched for the entered username and password. If a match is found, te user is logged into the system and set as active.

      • logoutUser

        public void logoutUser()
        When the logout button is pressed, this method is called and returns the user to the login screen and sets the production tabs to disabled.

      • addProductButton

        public void addProductButton()
        This method gets the input from the name, manufacturer and type fields, saves them to a SQL String query, checks the fields to make sure they're not null, then sends myString into the call to insertToDB and creates a product object in a switch statement that has cases based on the saved ItemType enumeration from the input. This object will be saved into the product list upon program start.

      • recordProductionButton

        public void recordProductionButton()
        This method takes a selected product and number and creates a new production record with them along with the time the production record was created. It then saves the production record to the database.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        I used this main method to generate the config.properties file and save my database information to it. It also calls the reverseString() method to partially encrypt the file.
        Parameters:
        args - default parameter.
